BIERa
2014/KER/45
IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT:
THE HONOURABLE MR.JUSTICE HARUN-UL-RASHID
WEDNESDAY, THE 1ST DAY OF JANUARY 2014/11TH POUSHA, 1935
Crl.MC.No. 4 of 2014 ()
CP 92/2013 of J.M.F.C.-II, HOSDRUG
CRIME NO.1117/2011 OF HOSDURG POLICE STATION , KASARGOD
PETITIONER(S)/15TH ACCUSED:
M.BASHEER AGED 27 YEARS
S/0.B.K.ABOOBACKER
RESIDING AT FARZANA MANZIL MURIYANAVI, KANHANGAD
HOSDURG TALUK, KASARAGOD DISTRICT.
BY ADV. SRI.T.MADHU
COMPLAINANT(S)/RESPONDENT:
THE STATE OF KERALA
THROUGH THE STATION HOUSE OFFICER
HOSDURG POLICE STATION, KASARAGOD DISTRICT
REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR
HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM 682031
BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT.S.HYMA
THIS CRIMINAL MISC, CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
01-01-2014, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

BED
2014/KER/45
HARUN-UL-RASHID, J.
Cri.M.C No.4 Of 2014
Dated this the 1* day of January, 2014.
ORDER

Accused No.1i5 in Crime No.1117/2011 of Hosdurg Police
Station pending as C.P.No.92/2013 on the file of the Judicial First
Class Magistrate Court-I, Hosdurg is the petitioner. The offences
alleged against the petitioner are punishable under Sections 143,
147, 148, 452, 427 r/w 149 IPC. Investigation of the crime is
completed and the police filed a final report charge sheeting the
accused before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I,
Hosdurg. It is submitted that since the petitioner was in Mumbai
in connection with his employment, he was unaware of the
proceedings pending against him and hence he was not in a
position to appear before the court below. The learned
Magistrate issued non-bailable warrant for his non-appearance.
According to the petitioner, there is absolutely no_ willful
negligence or latches on the part of the petitioner in appearing
before the court below. Crl.M.C is filed seeking a direction to the
court below to consider the bail application on the date of
surrender itself.

Pua
2014/KER/45
rine
Crl.M.C.No.4 Of 2014
2. The petitioner is willing to surrender before the court
below. Now, the petitioner seeks a direction to the Judicial First
Class Magistrate Court-II, Hosdurg to consider his bail application
on the date of surrender itself.
Accordingly, the Crl.M.C is disposed of directing the Judicial
First Class Magistrate Court-II, Hosdurg to consider and pass
appropriate orders on the bail application, if any, filed by the
petitioner on the date of surrender itself with prior notice to the
Assistant Public Prosecutor, in the event of the petitioner
surrendering before the court below within a period of fifteen
days from today. The warrant issued against the petitioner shall
be kept in abeyance till the disposal of the bail application.
HARUN-UL-RASHID,
Judge.
